content: #92819 replaces some hand-rolled atty functions with the atty crate. I don't see any issues with the implementation, but are we okay with adding the dependency? I personally like the idea of using a crate instead of a hand-rolled implementation, but it is a very small surface area change.
looks other items in the rust repo already depend on it, so I think there's no incremental risk in adding it as a rustdoc dependency. I'm in favor.
Yeah, I think rustc or some other part of the repo already uses it
You'll see that the Cargo.lock change is very minimal
Yep, I see it only adds atty as a dep of rustdoc, meaning there's already an atty block somewhere else in the lockfile. Then I have no qualms approving the PR
